Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: Vectara provides a generative AI product platform for embedding generative AI features into applications. The company's product is an end-to-end Serverless Retrieval Augmented Generation API platform for embedding powerful generative AI functionality into applications, chatbots, and products with results grounded in, and never trained on, the data, documents, and knowledge they have. Built on a solid hybrid-search core, Vectara delivers the shortest path to a correct answer-action through a safe, secure, and trusted entry point that allows businesses to quickly, safely, and affordably integrate conversational AI and question-answering into their application with zero-shot precision. Vectara's serverless RAG platform solves critical problems required for enterprise adoption, namely: reduces hallucination, provides explainability, and provenance, enforces access control, allows for real-time updatability of the knowledge, and mitigates intellectual property and bias concerns from large language models.

Description: Eventual makes processing images, video & audio as easy as SQL. Their platform helps AI companies handle petabytes of multimodal data.
Top 5 Investors: Citi, Y Combinator, Felicis, Caffeinated Capital, The House Fund
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Internet Services, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: Eventual is tackling one of the hardest infrastructure problems in AI: making multimodal data (images, video, audio) as easy to process as SQL tables. While every company races to build AI applications, they're stuck forcing tools designed for bank transactions to handle petabytes of video and images. Our platform eliminates months of infrastructure work, letting developers query massive multimodal datasets with simple Python scripts that automatically scale. Built on our open-source Daft engine, we deliver 10x performance improvements and handle all the messy realities of production AI workloads—from out-of-memory errors to flaky API calls. We're already processing petabytes daily at companies like Amazon, Together AI, and CloudKitchens, powering everything from autonomous vehicles to foundation model training

Industries: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Big Data, Machine Learning, Productivity Tools, Software
Description: Chalk is a data platform for AI inference that provides the infrastructure needed to operationalize machine learning and AI.
Top 5 Investors: General Catalyst, Felicis, Unusual Ventures, Core Innovation Capital, Xfund
Founders: Andrew Moreland, Elliot Marx, Marc Freed-Finnegan
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: Chalk is a data platform that powers machine learning and generative AI. Chalk's best-in-class developer experience enables data teams to declare features and their dependencies with idiomatic Python in online, streaming, and batch environments. Chalk compiles these definitions into parallel pipelines that run on a Rust-based engine. These pipelines use the same source code to serve temporally consistent training sets to data scientists and live feature values to models. This re-use ensures that feature values from online and offline contexts match and dramatically cuts development time. With Chalk, engineers, data scientists, and analysts can focus on their unique products while Chalk seamlessly handles data infrastructure.

Full Description: Fibr is a cutting-edge AI-powered platform designed to tackle the escalating challenge of customer acquisition costs (CAC) in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. As third-party cookies are phased out and privacy regulations become more stringent, traditional marketing methods are increasingly insufficient for driving down CAC and maximizing ROI. Fibr addresses this issue with its advanced personalization solutions, which enhance the effectiveness of every marketing interaction. The company's Web Pilot is an innovative tool that generates personalized, landing pages for every ad, email, and communication. This technology ensures that each user interaction is tailored to individual preferences and behaviors, significantly improving engagement and conversion rates. By providing a personalized experience across all touchpoints, Fibr helps businesses optimize their marketing spend and reduce CAC effectively. Complementing Web Pilot is Fibr’s AI Blocks, which simplifies adapting and repurposing successful content across different formats and channels. This tool ensures that marketing messages remain relevant and compelling, whether used in ads, social media posts, or emails. With Fibr, businesses can deliver cohesive, on-brand experiences at scale, streamline content creation, and achieve superior marketing results. By leveraging Fibr’s AI-driven personalization, companies can navigate the challenges of a cookie-less future and drive down CAC, making their marketing efforts more efficient and impactful.

Industries: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Compliance, EdTech, Enterprise Software, GovTech, SaaS
Description: AI-powered digital reading augmentation platform transforming PDF accessibility.
Top 5 Investors: LvlUp Ventures, Elba L., James R., Phil C.
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Education, Government and Military, Information Technology, Professional Services, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: AI-powered digital reading augmentation platform transforming PDF accessibility. Lexibl is pioneering cognitive augmentation in digital reading through AI-driven technology that transforms how people consume and process information. Initially focused on serving the 1 billion+ people globally affected by dyslexia, Lexibl's platform uses machine learning and computer vision to create personalized reading environments that adapt to users rather than forcing users to adapt to content. The platform specifically serves secondary education (grades 6-12), higher education, and professional environments where digital reading accessibility is crucial for compliance and inclusion. The company's core technology stack includes Focus Lens for dynamic visual enhancement, Auto-Placeholder for intelligent position tracking, and Adaptive Formatting for real-time text optimization. A key differentiator is Lexibl's advanced Precision Tracking system, which maps content at both line and sentence levels, enabling granular user interaction analysis. This precise tracking capability feeds into Lexibl's LLM Integration system, providing rich data streams that power AI-enhanced comprehension and personalization features. These technologies can be integrated into existing document storage platforms, Learning Management Systems, and enterprise training environments, ensuring ADA compliance and Section 508 accessibility standards for government and educational institutions. Product: Lexibl's platform delivers: - AI-driven reading environment personalization - Real-time cognitive support and comprehension tools - Line and sentence-level content tracking - Rich data streaming for LLM enhancement - Enterprise-grade integrations with major document storage and LMS platforms - Section 508 and WCAG 2.1 compliance tools - API access for publishers, Government Agencies, and EdTech platforms - Seamless embedding into existing workflows and learning environments Business Model: Lexibl operates on a freemium model with premium features for individual users, enterprise licensing for educational institutions and corporations, and API licensing for integration partners. Special pricing and deployment models are available for government agencies and educational institutions. Market: Primary focus on three key markets: - Government agencies requiring digital accessibility compliance - Secondary and Higher Education (grades 6-12, universities) - Enterprise learning and development Customers: Target customers include: - Government agencies requiring Section 508 compliance - Middle schools and high schools (grades 6-12) - Higher education institutions - Corporate training departments - Educational publishers (McGraw Hill, Pearson, Wiley) - EdTech platforms - Individual learners and professionals Competitive Advantage: Unlike traditional reading tools or hardware-based cognitive augmentation solutions, Lexibl provides a software-based, scalable approach to reading optimization that integrates directly into existing digital ecosystems. Lexibl's AI-driven adaptability, precise content tracking capabilities, and LLM integration set it apart in the cognitive augmentation space. For government and educational institutions, Lexibl offers a turnkey solution for digital accessibility compliance while enhancing the reading experience for all users through its advanced tracking and AI-powered personalization features. The platform's ability to integrate with government systems and provide detailed content tracking while maintaining compliance standards makes it uniquely positioned in the GovTech and EdTech markets.

Industries: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Enterprise Software, Productivity Tools, SaaS, Software
Description: AI-powered productivity tool for busy professionals&teams to manage their day.
Top 5 Investors: LAUNCH, Treeo VC, Founder University
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: BeforeSunset is an AI-powered productivity tool to help teams and busy professionals with daily planning and time management. It offers various features to overcome the common challenges faced by businesses including; disorganized work, lack of focus, miscommunication, uncertain team morale, and inadequate planning. With AI power, it plans your day for you. We believe that to achieve success as a team, it's important for each individual to effectively plan their day and adhere to the plan. During the planning stage, 3 main questions need to be answered: “what do I need to work on?”, “how long will it take?” and, “how much time do I have?”.  Planning is important, but not enough by itself for success. Individuals need to maintain their focus throughout the execution of the plan. For ultimate focus, it is essential to minimize the distractions caused by unnecessary messages, switching between unfinished tasks, and losing track of time. With BeforeSunset’s workspace, you can plan your day by reviewing yesterday’s achievements, and unfinished tasks. You can stay on schedule throughout the day by keeping track of time for each task and focusing on one task at a time.  By tracking the time spent on each task, you can ensure that work is progressing as planned and make adjustments as needed. With analytics provided by BeforeSunset close your day by reviewing and reflecting on the progress you made. This detailed daily and weekly analysis can help you identify areas for improvement and plan your future work accordingly. Since work is not all we have, it is important to include personal planning in your day to make sure your daily plan is accurate. This doesn’t mean all your teammates see your personal todos on BeforeSunset. Our tool has the capability to make todos private if the user chooses. BeforeSunset's "Team Timeline" feature is designed for team members to share updates with the team such as; the task they're currently working on, their availability, meeting status, daily mood, whether they're working remotely or on-site, and who is currently working or taking time off. This helps keep everyone on the same page, prevent miscommunication, and minimize the need for additional communication. To sustain and improve productivity, reflection is provided by BeforeSunset’s analytics. These reports include information such as completed vs. unfinished tasks, meeting analytics, mood analytics, and how much effort the team spent on each tag.

Our proprietary software offers clinical decision support. The global market for MSK injuries is valued at a staggering 381 billion dollars, with an annual incidence rate of 129 billion cases annually. Despite these numbers, fewer specialists are available to provide care, and the number of patients far exceeds their management capacity. The lack of a proper triage mechanism has led to an alarming rate of physician burnout. Furthermore, delay in access to care can cause permanent damage and, in the worst cases, disability. Our AIML models will potentially function as Software as a Medical Device (SAMD).

With ESGgo companies can use either out-of-the-box sustainability SaaS solutions or if you are an enterprise you can use our plug-in ESGgo AI based data wrangling engine which connects to your existing data lake or ERP systems and visualization tools. Description: Embedded Loyalty, Fintech, Next-Gen Program Manager, AI/ML
Founders: Anuj Patel, Bruce Garner, John Taylor Garner
Industry Groups: Apps, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Financial Services, Mobile, Privacy and Security, Sales and Marketing, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: Odynn is an AI-powered, fully modular platform that helps fintechs, banks, card issuers, and travel companies launch embedded travel, loyalty, and rewards programs. Its white-label solution and APIs drive cardholder engagement while unlocking new revenue streams. Think Shopify for loyalty and travel. Current travel loyalty programs offer limited customizations, low engagement, high development cost, and lack of embedded financial features. We are solving the serious customer retention problem and lack of card use in the credit card industry today. There are more banks issuing more rewards credit cards than ever before and there are only a finite number of ways to differentiate your product on the issuing side. Yet there are really only two players on the acquiring side when it comes to travel redemption, Expedia and Booking.com. Banks know travel redemption is the solution to their problem. They just don't know how to do it properly. Odynn makes your cardholders stickier and generates significant revenue in a way that not only benefits your customers but also makes them happy! We know the name of the game is retention. Odynn not only increases retention and reduces churn, but also increases card spend, reduces CAC, provides diversified revenue, and ultimately increases customer lifetime value.  Our B2B partners can:  License our loyalty pricing and/or Traveler DNA APIs for standard SaaS fees Embed our white label loyalty travel portal charged per user Embed our holistic travel portal as a white label, where we pay our partners upwards of 70% of the net travel booking commissions Subscribe to our loyalty pricing data priced per volume

Full Description: Elythea is an ML/DL-driven platform that obstetricians in any setting use to predict risk for complications of pregnancy (postpartum hemorrhage, c-section, eclampsia) before they ever happen. We use information that is available at the point of care, so we can make the prediction as early as the 1st trimester, allowing doctors months to prepare in advance! We use clinical history/demographic information that is available at the point-of-care, so we can make the prediction as early as the 1st trimester, in developed or developing countries, allowing doctors months to prepare in advance!  Knowing high-risk earlier allows for blood/medicine/tailored clinical guidance to be prepared, reducing mortality/costs >90%. Our models use proprietary models to surpass gold standard risk assessments in the current clinical space. Our preliminary clinical trials have demonstrated 3x greater sensitivity for high risk classification of hemorrhage when comapred to the current widely used hemorrhage assessment score.

Industries: Artificial Intelligence (AI), CleanTech, Electrical Distribution, FinTech, Geospatial, Information Technology, Insurance, InsurTech, Power Grid, Property Insurance
Description: Athena is a geospatial intelligence company, with a pre-wildfire solution in use by utilities, communities and financial organizations.
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Energy, Financial Services, Information Technology, Navigation and Mapping, Science and Engineering, Software, Sustainability
Full Description: Athena is a data vendor, providing conditional, geospatial data related to future wildfire probabilities. Designed for use by insurance actuaries, the AI/machine language tool is best described as a Hierarchical Classification and Probabilistic Ensemble Model which converts best-in-class wildfire data, from multiple siloed government and academic sources, into easily usable data, updated quarterly, for a rolling 12-month future period. The data is traceable to original sources, highly nuanced and granular while still being usable at landscape scale.  The primary customers are electric utilities (IOU and POU), but municipalities(CWPPs) and some financial organizations are also customers. For utilities, the uses include Wildfire Mitigation Plan Maps (WMP), Public Safety Shutoff Plans (PSPS), circuit level wildfire risk, vegetation management, fire path spread models and Risk-Spend Efficiency (ROI) models.  The data is designed for business decision making.

Description: InboxCRM by AppEQ is a Gmail‐native CS platform that shows account health, engagement, and renewal insights in your inbox—auto‐logging.
Top 5 Investors: GSF, Varakumar Namburu, Hiro Mashita, Khadim Batti, Vispi Daver
Industry Groups: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data and Analytics, Science and Engineering, Software
Full Description: InboxCRM by AppEQ is a Gmail‐native Customer Success platform designed to eliminate context switching and streamline account management by bringing key customer metrics directly into the inbox. Founded on the premise that Customer Success teams spend too much time toggling between disparate tools—spreadsheets, CRM systems, and email—AppEQ built InboxCRM to merge those workflows into a single, intuitive workspace inside Gmail. By automatically importing account and contact data from email and calendar, InboxCRM delivers real‐time account health scores, engagement metrics, renewal risk indicators, and usage insights, all without leaving your inbox. Since its launch, InboxCRM has been adopted by hundreds of Customer Success leaders at B2B SaaS companies ranging from 50 to 500 employees. By drastically reducing manual reporting and enabling data‐driven decision‐making directly in Gmail, AppEQ’s solution empowers teams to increase retention rates, accelerate upsell motions, and deliver personalized, proactive support at scale. Whether you’re a solo CS professional or part of a global CS organization, InboxCRM seamlessly integrates into your existing workflows to help you focus on what matters most—building customer loyalty and driving revenue growth. AppEQ is headquartered in Bangalore, India , and is backed by GSF, SGGrow, Khadim, Vara and more . For more information, visit www.appeq.ai or connect with us on LinkedIn.
